programme.desc: Nigel Marven explores the stunningly beautiful country of Guatemala, uncovering a wealth of wildlife, dramatic scenery and ancient Maya history along the way. Join him to see the world's most beautiful lake, Central America's most colourful pitviper and incredible views from the 'top of the Maya world'. There are Quetzals, jays and orchids in the cloud forests and venomous lizards in the arid interior.

programme.title: Europe's New Wild
programme.desc: In Bulgaria's Rhodopes Mountains, a wildlife revival is underway. As prey animals return and reshape the land, so do predators. But to fully reforge the circle of life, it's vultures that hold the key..

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Join affable presenter Nigel Marven as he discovers the colourful and varied wildlife of Costa Rica. Meet Scarlet Macaws on the Osa Peninsula, playful Spotted Dolphins in the Gulf of Dulce, a 'Christmas Tree' Eyelash Palm Pitviper, baby Leatherback Turtles on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast and a group of colourful kings in the north of the country.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: A major storm blows into Central Michigan, and as the snow piles up, so do the cases! While clients brave the weather to get care for their animals, Dr. Pol and Charles battle thundersnow when responding to an emergency farm call. Dr. Lisa needs ten stitches to repair a horses deep cut, and Dr. Brenda treats a Rottweilers very swollen face. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Spring brings a baby boom of goats, reindeer, and Labrador pups. When a chicken is the victim of fowl play, Dr. Pols on the case. Dr. Brenda treats a fair steer to be ready for the ring and Dr. Lisa sutures a horses torn eyelid. An older cats labor stalled, so Dr. Nicole performs an emergency C-section to save the kittens. Charles and Diane surprise the docs on Vet Appreciation Day.

programme.title: Europe's New Wild
programme.desc: In the Carpathian mountains and other wildlife strongholds, nature is being given a helping hand. The reintroduction of European Bison and the spread of the Grey wolf across the continent signal a wildlife comeback which is benefiting not only other animals but humans as well..

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Join affable presenter Nigel Marven as he discovers the colourful and varied wildlife of Costa Rica. Meet Scarlet Macaws on the Osa Peninsula, playful Spotted Dolphins in the Gulf of Dulce, a 'Christmas Tree' Eyelash Palm Pitviper, baby Leatherback Turtles on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast and a group of colourful kings in the north of the country.

programme.title: Europe's New Wild
programme.desc: Across Iberia, food chains and ecosystems are being restored allowing endangered animals, including the rarest cat in the world, to flourish.

programme.title: Untamed Philippines
programme.desc: Moving from turtles of the Palawan coast to the unique National Marine Park at Tubbataha, to meet giants, whale sharks and manta rays. We also see how people can mediate between people and wildlife as we join a snake hunting team catching and translocating a deadly Samar cobra.

programme.title: Wild Mongolia: Land Of Extremes
programme.desc: Trapped on a mountain plateau at the heart of Asia, lies one of the most extreme desert environments in the world, The Gobi. .
